body.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science
Department of Industrial Engineering and Management Systems

courseSection0.text:
College of Engineering & Computer Science
Dr. Timothy Kotnour
407-823-5645
Timothy.Kotnour@ucf.edu

p.Provides a knowledge base in technical l: Provides a knowledge base in technical leadership and management principles and practices in a technical environment. This certificate is designed to enhance the student's marketability, preparation and career viability as they enter the engineering and computer science professions.

li.Students must have a declared Computer S: Students must have a declared Computer Science, Information Technology, or engineering major. Not open to students in engineering pending majors.

courseSection0.text:
Provides a knowledge base in technical leadership and management principles and practices in a technical environment. This certificate is designed to enhance the student's marketability, preparation and career viability as they enter the engineering and computer science professions.
Minor Admission Requirements
Students must have a declared Computer Science, Information Technology, or engineering major. Not open to students in engineering pending majors.
Minor Requirements
None
Prerequisite Courses
None

courseSection0.text0: Discipline specific design course in engineering or Computer Science or CAP 4102 in the case of Information Technology majors.
courseSection0.text1:
Earn at least 7 credits from the following: 
LDR2001 - Foundations of Leadership (2)
LDR2002 - Intermediate Foundations of Leadership (2)
EGS3030 - Leadership in Engineering I 
EGS3031 - Leadership in Engineering II 
EGS4950 - Engineering Leadership Capstone (3)
courseSection0.text2: Discipline specific design course in engineering or Computer Science Credit Hours: 3
courseSection0.text3:
Pick one of the following
MAR3391 - Professional Selling (3)
ENT4183 - Technological Entrepreneurship (3)

courseSection1.text3: PHI3638 - Ethical Issues in the 21st Century (3)
courseSection1.text4: PHI3626 - Advanced Ethics in Science and Technology (3)

li.Students must have a minimum grade of \": Students must have a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in each course or Satisfactory (in eligible courses) required for the minor.
li.Not open to students seeking the Enginee: Not open to students seeking the Engineering Leadership Certificate.
li.Any course substitution must be approved: Any course substitution must be approved by the Associate Dean responsible for Undergraduate Curriculum within CECS.

courseSection2.text:
Other Requirements

Students must have a minimum grade of "C" (2.0) in each course or Satisfactory (in eligible courses) required for the minor.
Not open to students seeking the Engineering Leadership Certificate.
Any course substitution must be approved by the Associate Dean responsible for Undergraduate Curriculum within CECS.
